issues.title: Set up Azure AKS cluster with Terraform
issues.description: Deploy Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster using Terraform with proper networking, node pools, and Azure integrations.
acceptance_criteria: 3-5 nodes running and schedulable (adjust based on budget)
System node pool and user node pool separated
Cluster metrics available via Azure Monitor (optional)

tasks.name: Create Terraform modules for Azure infrastructure
tasks.prompt:
Create Terraform configuration for Azure AKS:
1. Resource Group for Fawkes platform
2. Virtual Network with subnets (AKS nodes, services, pods)
3. AKS cluster with:
   - System node pool (2 nodes, Standard_D4s_v3)
   - User node pool (2-3 nodes, Standard_D4s_v3)
   - Auto-scaling enabled (min 2, max 10)
   - Azure CNI networking
   - Managed identity
   - Azure Monitor integration (optional)
4. Azure Container Registry (ACR)
5. Azure Key Vault for secrets
6. Storage account for Terraform state
7. Log Analytics workspace
Use azurerm provider, follow Azure best practices.

tasks.name: Create deployment script for Azure
tasks.prompt:
Create bash deployment script:
1. Check prerequisites: az CLI, terraform, kubectl
2. Authenticate to Azure (az login)
3. Create resource group if not exists
4. Initialize Terraform with Azure backend
5. Run terraform plan and apply
6. Get AKS credentials (az aks get-credentials)
7. Verify cluster health (nodes, system pods)
8. Enable add-ons (monitoring, policy, if desired)
9. Output cluster info (endpoint, resource group, node count)
Include error handling and rollback options.

tasks.name: Create Azure cost estimation tool
tasks.prompt:
Create cost estimation script:
1. Calculate monthly costs for:
   - AKS cluster (control plane + nodes)
   - Storage (disks, files)
   - Load balancer
   - Public IPs
   - Bandwidth
   - Container registry
2. Output cost breakdown by service
3. Compare to budget target ($300-500/month)
4. Suggest optimizations if over budget
Use Azure pricing API or hardcoded rates.

tasks.name: Document Azure AKS setup
tasks.prompt:
Create comprehensive documentation:
1. Azure prerequisites (subscription, permissions)
2. Cost considerations and budgeting
3. Architecture diagram (VNet, AKS, ACR, etc.)
4. Step-by-step deployment guide
5. Access management (RBAC, Azure AD)
6. Scaling considerations
7. Backup and disaster recovery
8. Troubleshooting common Azure issues
9. Cost optimization tips
10. Upgrade procedures

tasks.name: Create InSpec tests for AKS
tasks.prompt:
Create InSpec tests for AKS:
1. Cluster exists and is running
2. Node count meets minimum (2+ nodes)
3. All nodes are Ready
4. System pods are Running
5. Azure CNI configured
6. Managed identity enabled
7. Network policy enabled (if configured)
8. RBAC enabled
Use azure and kubernetes InSpec resources.

issues.validation:
# Authenticate to Azure
az login

# Deploy cluster
./scripts/deploy-azure-cluster.sh

# Verify cluster
kubectl get nodes
kubectl get pods -A
az aks show --resource-group fawkes-rg --name fawkes-aks

# Run tests
inspec exec infra/azure/inspec/ -t azure://

# Check costs
./scripts/azure-cost-estimate.sh

issues.title: Configure Azure Load Balancer and Ingress
issues.description: Configure Azure Load Balancer and deploy nginx-ingress controller for external access.
acceptance_criteria: TLS certificates configured (Let's Encrypt or Azure)

tasks.name: Deploy nginx-ingress with Azure LB
tasks.prompt:
Create Helm values for nginx-ingress on Azure:
1. Enable Azure Load Balancer (type: LoadBalancer)
2. Configure static public IP (optional)
3. Enable PROXY protocol for Azure LB
4. Set up annotations for Azure LB configuration
5. Configure TLS termination
6. Enable metrics for Prometheus
7. Resource limits appropriate for Azure
Create ArgoCD Application.

tasks.name: Configure Azure DNS (optional)
tasks.prompt:
Create Terraform for Azure DNS:
1. Azure DNS zone (if using custom domain)
2. A records for ingress public IP
3. Wildcard record for subdomains (*.fawkes.yourdomain.com)
4. DNS zone delegation if needed
Optional: Use external-dns for automatic DNS management.

tasks.name: Configure cert-manager with Let's Encrypt
tasks.prompt:
Deploy cert-manager for TLS:
1. Install cert-manager via Helm
2. Configure ClusterIssuer for Let's Encrypt (or Azure Key Vault)
3. Create Certificate resources for services
4. Configure ACME DNS challenge (if using Azure DNS)
5. Test certificate issuance
Create ArgoCD Application.

issues.validation:
# Check Load Balancer
kubectl get svc -n ingress-nginx
az network lb list --resource-group MC_fawkes-rg_fawkes-aks_*

# Test ingress
curl https://test.yourdomain.com

# Check certificates
kubectl get certificates -A

issues.title: Configure Azure persistent storage (Disks and Files)
issues.description: Configure Azure Disk and Azure Files storage classes for persistent storage.
acceptance_criteria: Test PVC can be created and bound

tasks.name: Create Azure storage classes
tasks.prompt:
Create StorageClass manifests:
1. azure-disk-premium (Premium SSD, for databases)
2. azure-disk-standard (Standard SSD, for less critical)
3. azure-file (Azure Files, for ReadWriteMany)
4. Set appropriate reclaim policies
5. Enable volume expansion
6. Configure backup tags
Set azure-disk-premium as default.

tasks.name: Configure Azure Backup for persistent volumes
tasks.prompt:
Configure Azure Backup:
1. Create Recovery Services vault
2. Configure backup policies for disks
3. Enable automatic backup for tagged PVCs
4. Set retention policy (7 days daily, 4 weeks weekly)
5. Configure backup alerts
Use Terraform azurerm_recovery_services_vault.

tasks.name: Create storage testing manifests
tasks.prompt:
Create test manifests:
1. PVC for Azure Disk
2. PVC for Azure Files
3. Test pods that write/read from volumes
4. Verify volume expansion
5. Test snapshot/restore
Include cleanup scripts.

issues.validation:
# Check storage classes
kubectl get storageclass

# Create test PVCs
kubectl apply -f tests/integration/azure-storage-test.yaml
kubectl get pvc

# Verify bound and working
kubectl describe pvc test-azure-disk
kubectl describe pvc test-azure-file

tasks.name: Deploy Azure Database for PostgreSQL

tasks.name: Configure workload identity for Backstage

2. Grant PostgreSQL access
3. Grant Azure Blob access (for TechDocs)
4. Configure service account with identity
5. Test identity-based authentication
Use Azure AD Workload Identity.
